intro: Stenanthus serratus, commonly known as the narrowleaf stenanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniacaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. Stenanthus serratus is often found in shaded environments and is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
